description: Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada requires a qualified contractor to install a cured in place pipe (CIPP) liner in the downstream portion of the low level outlet at Roughbark Dam. Roughbark Dam is located 23km southeast of Weyburn SK. The dam is 11m high with a concrete gatewell near the center of the dam which will be dewatered for the duration of the work. The downstream pipe is approx. 40m long, 300mm diameter CSP pipe.

full_summary:
### Title
Lower Level Outlet, Conduit Lining Repair - Roughbark Creek Dam

### Tender Reference and Documentation
**Reference Number:**  cb-42-37735146
**Solicitation Number:** 4547-928-7R9-0-C5
**Amendment Number:** 4
**Publication Date:** 2023-10-24
**Closing Date:** 2023-11-08T12:00:00

### Contract Description
Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada invites bids from qualified contractors to install a cured-in-place pipe (CIPP) liner in the downstream portion of the low-level outlet at the Roughbark Creek Dam. The dam is located approximately 23 kilometers southeast of Weyburn, Saskatchewan, and is a critical piece of infrastructure for the agricultural industry. The scope of work includes installing a CIPP liner in the downstream pipe, approximately 40 meters in length and 300mm in diameter.

### Solicitation Method
This is a two-phase solicitation process. Bidders are required to submit a Phase One bid that covers only their qualifications and experience. A combination of the Phase One and Phase Two submissions constitute the final bid. Upon evaluation of the Phase One bids, bidders will be advised of their competitive standing, and responsive Phase One bidders will be invited to submit a Phase Two bid. The Phase Two bid will cover pricing, and the evaluation criteria will be based on a combination of both Phase One and Phase Two submissions.

### Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation criteria for this solicitation are outlined in the attached tender documents.

### Important Dates and Instructions
The Phase One electronic bid submission deadline is 2023-11-08T12:00:00. Bidders must submit their Phase One bid electronically via email to the contracting authority's email address, with the subject line clearly indicating the Phase One bid submission. The solicitation closing date and time should also be included in the email. Bidders should ensure that their electronic bid submission, including the Phase One Qualifications Form and any required associated documents, is received by the specified deadline.

### Contact Information
For more information, please contact Melissa Smith at melissa.smith3@agr.gc.ca or (305) 515-4796.

### Evaluation and Selection Process
The evaluation and selection process for this solicitation will be based on the criteria outlined in the attached tender documents.

### Trade Agreements
This solicitation is open to contractors who have a valid contract with Agriculture and Agri
